content.prompt: Which of the following is true of a government?

choices.label: A government is highly institutionalized and difficult to change.
A government is insulated from public opinion.
A government consists of a president and an executive branch of a country.
A government consists of a set of institutions empowered to make binding decisions.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Describe political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
